subject: Programming
title: Brendan Eich and JavaScript
description: A 60-second lesson on Brendan Eich and JavaScript.

hook.text: Brendan Eich built the programming language of the web in just ten days.

buildup.text: Netscape needed a scripting language for browsers in 1995. Eich was given ten days to deliver.

discovery.text: JavaScript made web pages interactive â€” buttons responded, forms validated, content changed live.

twist.text: The rush left quirks so bizarre that JavaScript became both the most used and most mocked language.

climax.text: Today JavaScript runs in every browser, on servers, in apps, and even on spacecraft.

punchline.text: Ten rushed days shaped the entire web.

quiz.question: How long did it take to create JavaScript?
